derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin unanimus (from unus 'one' + animus 'mind') + -ous

entry.tran: （所有人）一致同意的，全体一致的，无异议的
entry.def: When a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about something or all vote for the same thing.

example.ex: Editors were unanimous in their condemnation of the proposals...
example.tran: 编辑人员一致谴责这些提议。

example.ex: They were unanimous that Chortlesby Manor must be preserved.
example.tran: 他们一致认为必须对乔特勒斯比庄园加以保护。

entry.tran: （投票、决定、协议等）全体同意的，无异议的，一致通过的
entry.def: A unanimous vote, decision, or agreement is one in which all the people involved agree.

example.tran: 投票一致同意匈牙利成为会员国
他们的决定是全体一致通过的。

means.word_mean: 2. acting together as a single undiversified whole;

in无+anim生命,精神+ate……的→adj.无生命的
long长+anim生命+ous……的→生命耐久→忍耐的
magn大+anim生命+ous……的→大生命→心胸博大
un=uni一个+anim生命+ous……的→[大家]同一个生命→一致的
anim生命,精神+al物→有生命的东西→动物
animate[v.使有生气,活泼]+ion动作或状态→animation生动;动画
anim生命,精神+osity多……的状态→生命太多→由爱变恨→仇恨
equ平等+anim生命+ity表名词→生命平等→平静
